StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: PESBART: Effects of Physical Environment and Stress in Blacks in relation to Asthma severity and Response to Therapy

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The PESBART project was supported by grant number R01HS011966 from the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality. We wish to acknowledge the following contributors to the PESBART Study: the Channing Center and Asthma Research Center at Brigham & Women’s Hospital, the Harvard School of Public Health, the Harvard Center for Geographic Analysis and the Harvard Clinical Research Institute.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Asthma and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Asthma, IRB, PUB, MDS, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-ASTHMA-IRB-PUB-MDS-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Asthma and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
